results.title: The Car and the city
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
The automobile is a serious polluter of the air and a major interruption to urban activities. So planners are looking at ways to change or limit the use of the conventional automobile in large cities, and to ease mass transit flow. Features William Lear’s 1975 steam car, a representative of the US EPA and John Esposito from the Ralph Nader Center for Study of Responsive Law, and Helen Leavitt, author of “Super-highway, super hoax”.

results.title: The Keeping of the green
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
As the population density of cities increases there is greater pressure to devote existing green areas to profitable industrial and residential uses. This film examines the need for green areas in cities - for recreation, for beauty and for relieving the effects of urban crowding.
results.description:

results.title: You can help - throw it here
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
In the past we have burnt and buried waste but today such solutions are inadequate. Here, retrieval recycling, and other environmentally positive forms of waste disposal, including “Mount Trashmore” - a recreational park complete with ski-run, built with waste from neighbouring communities - are examined

results.title: Traffic or transit
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”
Mass transit is an alternative to traffic-clogged city streets, but most urban transit systems are losing passengers. Two cities are actually attracting new riders: Hamburg, Germany, through reliable, efficient service, and Toronto, Canada with expanding service, which will soon include fast, noiseless, non-polluting magnetic suspension trains. Also surveyed is the innovative mass transit technology being tried in other cities.

results.title: A Place to live
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Human struggle for shelter is as old as the struggle for food. The film examines the problems to be faced in the future of human settlements. How can they be solved in industrialised urban areas like New Zealand, and how different are the requirements of rural areas in a developing country like Indonesia. A significant feature of the film is the on-going comparison between Djkarta and Auckland - with some interesting changes 21 years on.

results.title: The Limits to growth
results.creator_credit: Osborn Segerberg and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Massachusetts Institute of Technology published a book, “The Limits to Growth”. Questions raised by that book included: Is it time to stop growing - in population, in capital investments, in material things - or is that the road to continued poverty for the poorer nations of the world? This film examines both sides of the question.

results.title: Home to the sea
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Examines rights of passage, fishing and mineral concessions, and the kinds of ecological safeguards needed to assure that the natural resources of the sea will be protected from exploitation by selfish national interests.

results.title: The Day after tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin, University of the State of New York and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses the use of solar power, geothermal resources, and thermonuclear fusion as energy sources.

results.title: The City with a future
results.creator_credit: Robert Dierbeck and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Examines two aspects of environmental city planning. Although Disney-World, Florida, is not a real city, the Disney planners have come up with some surprising technological solutions to urban problems. The film also shows how the citizens of Toronto have shown that it is possible to change the pattern of urban growth and make a city liveable again.
